features: Gentle scalp care: This fragrance-free conditioner is pH balanced for all hair types; helps prevent tangles and leaves hair more manageable
Mild conditioner: Our formula is sulfate-free, phosphate-free, protein-free and gluten-free; rinses easily without residue to help leave hair and scalp feeling renewed and conditioned
Free of common chemical irritants: Our products are free of dyes, fragrance, masking fragrance, lanolin, parabens and formaldehyde releasers
Dermatologist tested: Vanicream products are formulated with ingredients dermatologists consider desirable and not irritating or sensitizing to the skin
Directions: After shampooing, work a small amount of conditioner into hair; allow to remain for 1- 3 minutes, then rinse thoroughly with warm water
body.description: Free & Clear Conditioner has been specially created for persons who wish to avoid common chemical irritants found in most ordinary hair conditioners. It is free of Dyes, Lanolin, Fragrance, masking fragrance, protein, parabens, formaldehyde, and other preservatives. It is also sulfate-free, betaine-free, and gluten-free. Free & Clear Conditioner helps prevent tangles and leaves hair more manageable. It rinses easily without excess residue and leaves hair feeling clean and healthy. Helps leave hair and scalp soft and feeling renewed and conditioned.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The only conditioner that I've used for years!!
reviews.reviewText: At the time of writing this, I've been using this hair conditioner for six years. I love how moist and rejuvenating it makes my hair feel after showering. The ingredients are so basic, and there's no scent, which is what I find the best. This is non comedogenic, and very friendly to use at night as well before sleeping. I highly recommend this enriching conditioner.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Vanicream shampoo and conditioner
reviews.reviewText: I learned of this product from Dr. Dray on Utube.It is exactly what my scalp needed. It took me a while to realize I had a chronically irritated scalp from what I believe was from use of too many products with too many ingredients that didn’t rinse off well. All the heavy multifunction products built up in my scalp and didn’t let it breathe. Vanicream products remedied this while being gentle yet very effective on hair and scalp. My scalp feels so much better and is way less sensitive.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for chemical sensitive people
reviews.reviewText: My daughter is chemical sensitive after toxic mold exposure and finding a product that doesn't bother her was challenging. We learned choosing fragrance free seems to be key for us or at least have a mild light scent. She also doesn't need protein as it makes her hair straw like. Formaldehyde also causes issues. This omits all of them. I personally find this more drying than my cowash but she doesn't work the cowash into her hair well enough so this shampoo works great for her.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Not as soft as id like
reviews.reviewText: I understand this conditioners is limited on ingredients. That is the beneficial aspect for not having skin irritating additives. The downside to that is that it's quite "bland", and without other conditioning ingredients other conditioners have, it just doesn't make my hair soft and silky. It felt kinda brittle and weird.It did leave it softer than if I did no conditioner, I think.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I have tried so many shampoos and conditioners over the last few years since my hair texture and scalp started changing. My scalp has always been on the oily side, but it suddenly started getting super oily. So I tried lots of different conditioners. I tried only using conditioner on the very ends, skipping every other wash, every two washes, and eventually just leave in. My hair felt okay on the ends, but wasn’t shiny like it used to be. And my scalp was definitely dry and irritated, and even started flaking from it. Finally I tried this conditioner, and my hair feels almost back to normal! Even when I used it directly on my scalp for the first few washes to give my poor scalp some much needed moisture and tlc, my hair wasn’t greasy looking by the end of the day. My hair is shiny again, and it doesn’t irritate my sensitive skin at all! Even when only using other conditioners on the very ends of my hair, it looked fully dirty by the end of the day. This conditioner is seriously a lifesaver!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Keeps my hair soft and no scent. Hair still shines

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This product was not my favorite - I second all the reviews that mention how this product can feel a bit drying. I don't think it completely sucks out moisture from my hair, but it definitely does not feel moisturizing or nourishing to the hair. It does an okay job of conditioning it, but I can't bring myself to finish the bottle because I can't stand how it makes my hair feel dry and brittle. If fragrance free/clean ingredients are important to you, then this might be a good option for you. Otherwise, I'd suggest finding a different product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 5 stars for the product 0 for the container
reviews.reviewText: The product itself is great It takes only a drop to make my hair soft and manageable without flattening it. The problem is the plastic container. The conditioner is very thick and so it is difficult, if not impossible, to squeeze out because container is very stiff. This morning I couldn't get any out and, having just gotten the tube, couldn't believe it was empty. So I took a box cutter and sliced the tube in half. By the time I was finished doing a very sloppy job of spooning it out into a 16 oz. glass jar, you can see how much I rescued. And because I know glass isn't safe in the shower. I keep the jar on a shelf in the medicine cabinet and fill a little plastic container as needed. Why, oh why, can't the put it in the flexible tube like they use for their hair gel?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 8, 2023

reviews.reviewText: No smell, no irritation. Sometimes you need a second wash because it doesn’t emulsify as well as the “cheap” brands. But worth it for clear non-irritated skin!
Meets expectation! My skin has no reaction at all!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 25, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Due to health reasons this is the only scent- free conditioner I’m allowed to use. It works okay, but it is so thick you have to unscrew the top and squeeze it out. It has the consistency of body lotion.

reviews.reviewTitle: Huge quantities of product per wash required
reviews.reviewText: I appreciate this product. Don't get me wrong - it is fragrance free and carries none of the silicones. However, my biggest complaint is that this product fails to untangle my hair at regular amounts and thus I finish this product really quickly. I bought a second bottle, refusing to give up on this product so easily but when I realised what really bothered me, I knew I have to opt for something else. Try it, this product doesn't hurt but spend more time considering if you'll want to repurchase it.
